ygData.subject: Re: Shadowstep vs. Fade
ygData.msgSnippet: Shadow Step also only takes 2 seconds to cast rather than the 4 seconds for fade, so you are much more likely to cast it without being interupted in a melee
ygData.messageBody:
Shadow Step also only takes 2 seconds to cast rather than the 4 seconds for fade, so you are much more likely to cast it without being interupted in a melee situation.

-Shadowwalker of Karana
----- Original Message -----
From: Nemesis
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Sent: Sunday, April 18, 1999 10:59 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Shadowstep vs. Fade


You get a greater distance with Shadow Step. It has pulled me out of a jam more than once.


Neme


At 09:40 AM 4/18/99 -0400, you wrote:
>From: "Stefan Raets" <SRAETS@...>
>
>Can anyone tell me what is better about Shadowstep? From the
>description it seems very similar to Fade ... so why should I buy
>Shadowstep?
>
>Aznyin
>Erudite Wizard, level 10
